problem_text: Find m \angle ABD, given that m \angle ABC = 112.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠CBF, ∠GBF, ∠ABC, BC ⊥ CD, AD = CD, ∠CBD, ∠DBA, ∠CBE, ∠GBA, A on BF, ∠ABG, ∠FBG, D on BE, ∠EBF, ∠GBF, AB ⊥ AD, ∠GBE, ∠GBD, ∠DBF, ∠FBC, pi * (112 / 180) = ∠CBA, 3.14 = pi, C on BG, ∠ABG

Step 2:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : BC ⊥ CD
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠DCB

Step 3:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠ABC, ∠CBD, ∠DBA
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠ABC + ∠CBD + ∠DBA

Step 4:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠GBA
Conclusions: ∠GBA = 2 * pi - ∠ABG

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠CBF, A on BF
Conclusions: ∠CBA = ∠CBF

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : A on BF, ∠GBF
Conclusions: ∠GBA = ∠GBF

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠FBG, A on BF
Conclusions: ∠ABG = ∠FBG

Step 8:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : D on BE, ∠CBE
Conclusions: ∠CBD = ∠CBE

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : D on BE, ∠EBF
Conclusions: ∠DBF = ∠EBF

Step 10:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠GBF
Conclusions: ∠GBF = 2 * pi - ∠FBG

Step 11:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AB ⊥ AD
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠BAD

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠GBE, D on BE
Conclusions: ∠GBD = ∠GBE

Step 13:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠GBD, ∠ABG, ∠DBA
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠ABG + ∠DBA + ∠GBD

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : A on BF, ∠DBF
Conclusions: ∠DBA = ∠DBF

Step 15:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠FBC, A on BF
Conclusions: ∠ABC = ∠FBC

Step 16:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 6.28 = 2 * pi

Step 17:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠GBE, C on BG
Conclusions: ∠CBE = ∠GBE

Step 18:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on BG, ∠GBF
Conclusions: ∠CBF = ∠GBF

Step 19:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠FBG, C on BG
Conclusions: ∠FBC = ∠FBG

Step 20:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠ABG
Conclusions: ∠ABG = 2 * pi - ∠GBA

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (112 / 180) = ∠CBA, ∠CBA = ∠CBF
Conclusions: pi * (112 / 180) = ∠CBF

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠DCB, pi / 2 = ∠BAD
Conclusions: ∠BAD = ∠DCB

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DBA = ∠DBF, ∠DBF = ∠EBF
Conclusions: ∠DBA = ∠EBF

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠ABG + ∠DBA + ∠GBD, 6.28 = 2 * pi
Conclusions: 6.28 = ∠ABG + ∠DBA + ∠GBD

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CBD = ∠CBE, ∠CBE = ∠GBE
Conclusions: ∠CBD = ∠GBE

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FBC = ∠FBG, ∠ABC = ∠FBC
Conclusions: ∠ABC = ∠FBG

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CBF = ∠GBF, pi * (112 / 180) = ∠CBF
Conclusions: pi * (112 / 180) = ∠GBF

Step 28:
Theorem: Hypotenuse-Leg Congruent Theorem
Premises : ∠BAD = ∠DCB, AD = CD
Conclusions: △ABD ≅ △CBD

Step 29:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, ∠GBF = 2 * pi - ∠FBG, pi * (112 / 180) = ∠GBF
Conclusions: 3.14 * (112 / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠FBG

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠GBA = ∠GBF, pi * (112 / 180) = ∠GBF
Conclusions: pi * (112 / 180) = ∠GBA

Step 31:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △ABD ≅ △CBD
Conclusions: ∠BAD = ∠DCB, ∠CBD = ∠DBA

Step 32:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠ABG = ∠FBG, 3.14 = pi, ∠ABG = 2 * pi - ∠GBA, pi * (112 / 180) = ∠GBA
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 - pi * (112 / 180) = ∠FBG

Step 33:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, ∠GBA = 2 * pi - ∠ABG, ∠ABG = ∠FBG, pi * (112 / 180) = ∠GBA
Conclusions: pi * (112 / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠FBG

Step 34:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DBA = ∠EBF, ∠CBD = ∠GBE, ∠CBD = ∠DBA
Conclusions: ∠EBF = ∠GBE

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 - pi * (112 / 180) = ∠FBG, ∠ABC = ∠FBG
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 - pi * (112 / 180) = ∠ABC

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (112 / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠FBG, 3.14 * (112 / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠FBG
Conclusions: 3.14 * (112 / 180) = pi * (112 / 180)

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EBF = ∠GBE, ∠GBD = ∠GBE, ∠DBA = ∠EBF
Conclusions: ∠DBA = ∠GBD

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * (112 / 180) = pi * (112 / 180), pi * (112 / 180) = ∠GBA
Conclusions: 3.14 * (112 / 180) = ∠GBA

Step 39:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠GBA = 2 * pi - ∠ABG, 3.14 * (112 / 180) = ∠GBA
Conclusions: 3.14 * (112 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠ABG

Step 40:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 6.28 = ∠ABG + ∠DBA + ∠GBD, 3.14 * (112 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠ABG, 2 * pi = ∠ABC + ∠CBD + ∠DBA, 2 * 3.14 - pi * (112 / 180) = ∠ABC, ∠DBA = ∠GBD, ∠CBD = ∠DBA
Conclusions: 0.98 = ∠DBA
